headline: Legal Intern at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary: I moved to Nashville from Charlotte, North Carolina to pursue a degree in Public Relations, and in the process have enjoyed working with event logistics, while making a difference in my community. During my time at CMA, I developed a passion for the legal and business side of my work; so, I am currently pursuing my law degree at Belmont University College of Law.

positions.description:
-Managed and assigned parking for over 500 people at Nissan Stadium
-Assigned tickets to employees and artist camps
-Worked with security team regarding fake tickets, ticket confiscations, and arrests 
-One of two on-site contacts for last minute parking and ticket requests
positions.title: Ticketing and Parking Supervisor-2017 CMA Music Festival

positions.description:
-Scheduled all meetings and travel
-Organized and submitted monthly expense reports 
-Kept track of all schedule changes
-Conducted research for events and presentations
-Worked closely with other industry leaders and their assistants
positions.title: Interim Executive Assistant to CEO

positions.description:
-Managed over 1,600 RSVPs 
-Managed guest lists for both parties
-Worked with an online app company to set up our digital check-in system
-On-site contact for any last minute ticket requests
-Week of show organized and distributed artist credential packets
positions.title: Pre-Telecast and After Party Coordinator/Credential Coordinator-2016 CMA Awards

positions.description:
-Part of the Artist Check-In staff for the CMA Music Festival

positions.title: Credential and Parking Coordinator-2016 CMA Music Festival
